author: AccessWDUN Staff
title: Lady Lions crush Berea, 6-0
text:
Monday October 19th, 2015 10:53PM 9:59PM ( 54 minutes ago ) News Alert Posted 11:47AM on Monday 19th October 2015 ( 11 hours ago ) Lady Lions crush Berea, 6-0 By AccessWDUN Staff Related Articles UNG's Acimovic chosen as Peach Belt men's soccer Player of the Week Reich Earns USA South Rookie of the Week for Fifth Time in 2015 Piedmont men's soccer claims 2-0 win UNG women's soccer overpowers Motevallo, 4-1 
DEMOREST — Hosting the Mountaineers of Berea College for Senior Day, the Piedmont College women's soccer team cruised to a 6-0 result in its last non-conference contest of the 2015 regular season. Megan Hatfield started the offensive show with a smashed shot to the upper 90 in just the 8th minute of play for the early advantage. 
Six different Lady Lions scored on the afternoon including two freshmen in Alora McCoy with a score in the 13th minute and Sarah Weber with a goal in the 51st minute. For McCoy, the goal was her second in as many games as she also scored in yesterday's 4-1 win over LaGrange. 
Piedmont scored three goals in each half as Tori Gillett scored just before 28 minutes gone on perhaps one of the best goals all season after several combinations right at the top of the box. Cassidy Reich added to her season totals now at 14 with a penalty kick in the 71st before defender Haley Hall capped the scoring with a right-footed shot over the head of the Berea keeper in the 74th to put the final score at 6-nil. 
Senior Michaela Gardner kept the shutout in goal playing the full 90 for yet another clean sheet, her 12th such performance of the season. Associated Tags : college soccer, Piedmont women's soccer © Copyright 2015 AccessWDUN.com
